objects.name: AI-Generated Content Incorrectly Presented as Depicting Reality
objects.description:
Synthetic content created using generative AI tools (e.g., deepfakes, AI image, video, or audio) is incorrectly presented as a depiction of real-world material; i.e. captured by a camera, a recording device, or otherwise manually produced by a human without the use of AI.

To make this assertion, analysts need to identify that content shared has been AI-Generated, and that it was presented in the context of the media showing real life (e.g. posted alongside text which treats or reacts to the content as legitimate).

As AI continues to develop capability to produce more realistic media, it is difficult to provide a list of methods to spot materials that have been created using AI which will not rapidly become outdated; platforms providing AI media generation are attempting to make the materials they produce indistinguishable from media made by humans.

At the same time, organisations create tools designed to help identify AI-generated content, and publish resources listing the latest tells and identifiers for AI-generated content. Analysts may look for such tools or resources to help identify the use of AI.
